poem:
### Sicilian Flow

Parched, the silent stones  
of Troina whisper   
their thirst. Water—  
a shadow between  
two ancient fountains—  
held in the hands of men.  
When the sun bears down,  
one shall drink,  
the other, a cracked chorus:  
this is the song of drought  
that lingers in Sicilian bones.
